business.name: Courssaty
business.model: Online learning platform (similar to Coursera/Udemy for Arabic market)

monthly_revenue.note: No Courssaty revenue disclosed. Louai funds project through freelance work

freelance_work.time_split: Focus on Courssaty when possible, freelance for income
freelance_work.note: Project management pays well but takes high time/effort

team_composition.equity_structure: Has high equity/prestige but not specified percentages

funding_challenge_global.label: realistic_concerned
evidence: Last 2 years funding decreased, countries focusing inward not outward
America used to fund billions externally, now stopped (especially Jordan)
Many projects that depended on American funding stopped
Confirmed what Bilal observed about global funding decline

mentorship_nono_olga.label: highly_grateful_productive
evidence: Nono (main mentor) helped with accessible tech (WordPress not advanced)
Olga helped with marketing, branding, scaling Courssaty
Partnership ideas saved money on technical solutions
Reached out to Louai first after accelerator, very supportive
Can reach them anytime

ai_tools_usage.label: pragmatic_selective_use
evidence: Uses AI but not for human conversations
AI for reviewing conversation transcripts, highlighting missed points
'If I wanted AI to talk to, I'd just go to ChatGPT. I want the experience'
Wants human experience, not just information

acsi4_cohort_experience.label: valuable_peer_learning
evidence: Every session learned from at least one person
Everyone had unique experience + problems
Seeing others' problems + solutions was beautiful
Workshop on 'what do we need' was particularly valuable

explicit_needs.evidence: Last period focusing on automation - how things can save effort. Suggested Bloom should offer 2-3 week training on AI agencies, automation tools. 'Save effort, time, even money'
explicit_needs.reasoning: Can't hire many people, can't afford big teams. Automation helps small teams scale

explicit_needs.evidence: In Jordan, cost of filming courses is very high. Got free studio time through initiative/grant - beautiful opportunity
explicit_needs.note: Bloom funding bought equipment ($70% spent on physical assets like computers)

implied_needs.inference: Relies on freelancing to fund startup. Needs Courssaty itself to generate revenue so he can focus full-time
Values 1-on-1 mentorship far more than group training. Louai said meetings like this (Bilal call) help more than group sessions

core_values.evidence: Initially wanted advanced courses. Nono mentorship: Focus on accessible tech (WordPress, short projects 2 months not 6-9 months). 'People need to start working immediately'
'Why use AI for conversation? If I want AI, I go to ChatGPT. I want experience, not just information. That's why I schedule meetings'
'Funding will help us for short period. Knowledge will help us from first startup to last startup. Knowledge is what we must work on'
Bloom encouragement: 70% of funding on physical things (computers, equipment). 'It will last from first project to last. It continues'
Every ACSI4 session: 'Learned from at least one person. Everyone had unique experience, unique problem. Looking at others' problems and how they solve them was beautiful'

interest_level.label: pragmatically_interested_needs_proof_of_concept
evidence: On 2% revenue share for 10 years: 'Some will think like this, but many companies if they see the idea is working and strong, and they need funding to continue, I think they would agree'
Suggested pilot: Try with 1-2 teams at end of program, see if it works, then scale to next cohort
Values knowledge + community over just capital
interest_level.note: Pragmatic thinker - wants to see model tested before committing

co_design_contributions.description: Don't change entire program. At end of ACSI4 (Sept completion), ask 1-2 teams if they want to try revenue share model. Build track record, then offer to next cohort
co_design_contributions.reasoning: After program ends, clear who will continue vs quit. Better to ask teams with proven trajectory

co_design_contributions.description: Bilal's idea that Louai liked: Monthly email to 1000+ Bloom alumni, first 20 to submit problems get invited to 'kitchen' session where community helps solve
co_design_contributions.benefits: Self-selecting engaged alumni, not forcing attendance, organic community activation

most_valuable: Peer learning in sessions (everyone's unique problems)
Needs assessment workshop ('what do we need')
design_suggestions: Even more customized/personalized support (not just group training)
Track alumni progress: funding received, revenue milestones

readiness_assessment.reasoning: Strong hustler mentality (freelancing to fund startup), excellent mentorship utilization, knowledge-first philosophy. BUT: Courssaty itself not yet revenue-generating (relies on freelance income), early stage. Good candidate for pilot IF revenue starts flowing. Risk: Time split between freelancing + startup. Strength: Pragmatic thinker, strong execution on mentorship advice, accessible education mission.

recommendation.condition: If Courssaty generates revenue in next 6 months, strong candidate. Otherwise, wait for pilot proof-of-concept
support_needed: Scaling strategy for online learning platform
Connection to Corsy (Iraq learning platform) for partnership/learning
recommendation.unique_value: EdTech accessible education advocate, knowledge-first philosophy, Jordan representation, pragmatic pilot testing mindset, excellent mentorship utilization model, peer learning champion
recommendation.special_note: Louai's suggestion to pilot revenue share with 1-2 teams first is SMART. He's a pragmatic co-designer, not just participant.

corsy_iraq_learning_platform_partnership.description: Bilal knows Mortada + team at Corsy (Iraq online learning platform, similar model to Courssaty). Can connect for partnership/learning

specifics.similarity: Both online learning platforms, similar names even (Corsy vs Courssaty)
specifics.potential: Partnership, shared content, regional expansion, learning from each other

corsy_iraq_learning_platform_partnership.action_required: Bilal introduces Louai to Mortada/Corsy team

stability_fund_concept.description: Bilal's idea: Stability Fund where entrepreneurs contribute when they have money, draw when they don't (seasonal/project-based businesses)
stability_fund_concept.appeal_to_louai: Freelance income fluctuates. Some months high (project management), some months low. Buffer would help
stability_fund_concept.louai_response: Needs new funding approach. If idea is working and strong, companies will agree

monthly_alumni_problem_kitchen.description: Monthly email to 1000+ Bloom alumni: Submit your problem, first 20 selected for 'kitchen' session where community helps solve

benefits.community_solving: Smartest person in room is the room
benefits.data_gathering: Track who's active, what problems alumni face

monthly_alumni_problem_kitchen.louai_reception: I think it's good. I think more than 100 would apply
monthly_alumni_problem_kitchen.action_required: Bilal designs monthly kitchen model, launches pilot

revenue_share_pilot_test.description: Louai's suggestion: Don't change whole program. At end of ACSI4, ask 1-2 teams if they want to try 2% revenue share for 10 years. Build track record, offer to next cohort

reasoning.timing: After program ends, clear who continues vs quits

revenue_share_pilot_test.louai_quote: 'Continue as you are now, but maybe 1-2 teams try it. At end of program (Sept 9), you have good background on each team. Can you help more? I think next cohort will see it's a good approach'
revenue_share_pilot_test.action_required: Bilal selects 1-2 ACSI4 teams for pilot, proposes revenue share

key_quotes.on_knowledge_vs_funding: Funding will help us for a short period. But knowledge will help us from the first startup to the last startup. Knowledge is what we must work on
key_quotes.on_accessible_education: People in the beginning don't need information they learn in 6-9 months. Maybe a course or skill they learn in 2 months, they can start working immediately
key_quotes.on_human_experience_vs_ai: Why should I use AI for conversation if I want AI? Just go to ChatGPT. No need to schedule meetings. I don't want information. I want experience. That's why I schedule meetings
key_quotes.on_peer_learning: Every session, at least one thing you benefit from someone. Everyone had unique experience, unique problem. Looking at others' problems and how they solve them was very beautiful
key_quotes.on_funding_decline: Last 2 years, countries focusing on themselves more, opposite of before. Even America used to fund billions externally, now stopped. Projects depending on American funding, all stopped
key_quotes.on_revenue_share_idea: I'm sure many companies, if they really see the idea is working and strong, and they need funding to continue, I think they would agree
key_quotes.on_pilot_approach: Continue as you are now, but maybe 1-2 teams try it. After program (Sept completion), you have good background on teams. Next cohort will see it's a good approach
key_quotes.on_mentors: Nono and Olga reached out to me first. Very supportive. I can reach them anytime. They're really good. I can't reach one of you guys [laughs]

meta_insights.unique_contribution: EdTech accessible education advocate, Jordan representation, pragmatic pilot tester, knowledge-over-capital philosophy, excellent mentorship utilization model, human-experience values, cooperative co-designer (suggested pilot approach)
